main_definition: Princeton is a proper noun referring to the prestigious American university, or as an idiom representing excellence or high quality.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reference to Princeton University in New Jersey, USA
meanings_and_examples.example: He graduated from Princeton with honors.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used as a nickname for someone of high quality or excellence, often due to their association with Princeton University.
meanings_and_examples.example: Her research skills are top-notch; she's quite the 'Princeton.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: A playful term used among students to refer to something excellent or noteworthy, similar to calling a dish 'gourmet' or an item 'premium'.
meanings_and_examples.example: Their new software is quite the 'Princeton'; it really exceeded our expectations.

meanings_and_examples.definition: 'The real Princeton' - referring to something that epitomizes the best or a high standard, typically in academia.
meanings_and_examples.example: After studying abroad, he became accustomed to calling all good educational institutions 'the real Princeton.'
